p: Influenza is a common acute respiratory disease caused by influenza virus. Although influenza is frequently confused with the common cold, some individuals with influenza can become severely ill, to the point of hospitalization or even death. According to estimates of the World Health Organization, 5-10% of adults and 20-30% of children are infected by the influenza virus every year [ 1- 3]. Therefore, measuring the disease burden of seasonal influenza is of major interest among infection epidemiologists [ 4- 6].
